record.title: AMERICAN HOUSING RESCUE AND FORECLOSURE PREVENTION ACT OF 2008
record.narrative:
AMERICAN HOUSING RESCUE AND FORECLOSURE PREVENTION ACT OF 2008 -- (Senate - July 08, 2008)

[Page: S6448]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask the Chair to lay before the Senate a message from the House with respect to H.R. 3221.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A message from the House of Representatives to accompany H.R. 3221, an act to provide needed housing reform, and for other purposes.

speaking.paragraph: I now ask unanimous consent that all postcloture time be considered yielded back, and that the motion to concur be agreed to and the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I move to disagree to the amendments of the House, adding a new title and inserting a new section to the amendment of the Senate to H.R. 3221, and I send a cloture motion to the desk.

record.chair: The cloture motion having been presented under rule XXII, the Chair directs the clerk to read the motion.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

We, the undersigned Senators, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, hereby move to bring to a close debate on the motion to disagree to the amendments of the House, adding a new title and inserting a new section, to the amendment of the Senate to H.R. 3221, the Foreclosure Prevention Act.

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that the mandatory quorum be waived.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now move to concur in the amendment of the House adding a new title to the amendment of the Senate to H.R. 3221 with the amendment which is at the desk.

record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] proposes an amendment numbered 5067.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the reading of the amendment be dispensed with.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.chair: There appears to be a sufficient second.
record.narrative: The yeas and nays were ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I have a second-degree amendment at the desk. I ask for its consideration.

record.chair: The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid] proposes an amendment numbered 5068 to amendment No. 5067.
In the amendment, strike "3" and insert "2".
